sections.name: SECTION A - MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (MCQs)
instructions: Attempt all the Questions of this Section.
Do not copy down the part questions. Write only the answer against the proper number of the Question and its part according to the question Paper.

parts.question: The system will be stable in equilibrium when:
Corrosive effects on skin is caused by:
If pH value is greater than 7, then solution will be:
The functional group -COOH is used for:
The branch of Chemistry which deals with the hydrocarbon and their derivatives, is known as:
Amino acids are building block of:
The centrifuge machine is used for the separation of:
Ozone is a gas that is found in the layer of:
Fresh water is present on the surface of earth:
The citric acid is used in the preparation of cold drinks for

sections.name: SECTION B - Short Answer Questions
instructions: Answer any EIGHT questions from this section.

questions.question: Write a few points about society, technology & science.

The value of Kc for the reaction is 1 × 10⁻⁴: 2HI(g) = H₂(g) + I₂(g). At a given temperature, the molar concentration of reaction mixture is: HI = 2 × 10⁻⁵ mol.dm⁻³, H₂ = 1 × 10⁻⁵ mol.dm⁻³ and I₂ = 1 × 10⁻⁵ mol.dm⁻³. Predict the direction of the reaction.
What are the limitations of Arrhenius's Theory.
Find pH, pOH, [OH⁻] and [H⁺] of 2.46 × 10⁻⁹ M KOH solution.
What do you mean by Vital Force Theory?
Write down the molecular, structural and condensed formulae of the following compounds: (i) Methane (ii) Ethane (iii) Propane
Define the following: (i) Aldose (ii) Ketose (iii) Saccharides
Elaborate Amino acids as monomers or building block of protein.
How can we remove temporary hardness of water by Clark's method.
Write three characteristics of equilibrium constant Kc.
Give reason of the following: (i) Petroleum is 'Black Gold' (ii) Alkanes said to be saturated Hydrocarbons.

sections.name: SECTION C - Detailed Answer Question
instructions: Attempt any FOUR questions from this Section.

questions.question: Explain the process of sugar preparation from sugarcane.
What is high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC)? Explain it.
Distinguish between fat soluble and water soluble vitamin.
Differentiate between saturated and unsaturated hydrocarbons.
Define buffers. What is its composition? How are these utilized?
